sentence: Shares of home improvement retailer, The Home Depot, Inc.HD soared to a new 52-week high of $126.34 yesterday, before closing trade a notch lower at $126.18.
The stock's solid run at the index came after the company posted better-than-expected third-quarter fiscal 2015 results on Nov 17.
The company posted fiscal third-quarter adjusted earnings of $1.36 per share, which increased 18.3% from the year-ago quarter and beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.32.
Results benefitted from growth witnessed across all geographies and product categories on the back of improved transactions from both Do-It-Yourself and Pro customers.
Net sales advanced 6.4% to $21,819 million from $20,516 million in the year-ago quarter and were also ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $21,751 million.
The company's overall comparable-store sales (comps) increased 5.1% while comps in the U.S. grew 7.3%.

Driven by its robust performance so far in fiscal 2015 and in anticipation of a solid fourth quarter, Home Depot now expects its comps and earnings per share for the full fiscal year to be at the upper-end of its previously stated guidance.
However, sales growth is expected to be near the mid-point of the previous guidance range.
The company now projects sales growth of 5.7% compared with 5.2-6% rise expected earlier.
Comps are anticipated to increase 4.9% compared with the previously projected range of 4.1-4.9%.
Further, Home Depot now expects earnings per share to grow 14% to $5.36 per share.
Earlier, the company had projected earnings per share growth of 13-14% and earnings of $5.31-$5.36 per share.
The company's earnings per share guidance reflect the impact of its ongoing share repurchase program.
In the fourth quarter, the company plans to buy back another $2 billion worth of shares while in fiscal 2015 it plans to repurchase total $7 billion of shares.
Home Depot currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
A favorably ranked stock in the same industry is Tile Shop Holdings Inc. TTS , also with a Zacks Rank #2.
Other stocks performing well in the broader retail sector are American Eagle Outfitters Inc. AEO and L Brands Inc. LB , both carrying a Zacks Rank #2.
